EEG.jl Manual


Process EEG files in Julia.


For research only. Not for clinical use. Use at your own risk
.

docs.text: Process EEG files in Julia.  For research only. Not for clinical use. Use at your own risk .
docs.title: EEG.jl Manual

docs.text:
#


EEG.SSR
 
 
Type
.


Type for storing steady state response (SSR) data.


The minimum required information for SSR recording is stored in the type. Additional information can be stored in the 
processing
 field. To facilitate processing, specific names are used in the processing dictionary.


Fields




data
: contains the recorded data


trigers
: contains information about timing for creation of epochs


system_codes
: contains system information


samplingrate
: the sampling rate of the data


modulationrate
: the modulation rate of the stimulus


reference_channel
: the channel the data has been referenced to


file_path
 and 
file_name
: where the file was read in from


channel_names
: the names of the channels


processing
: dictionary type to store analysis


header
: additional information read from the file




Additional 
processing
 fields


The following standard names are used when saving data to the processing dictionary.




Name
: The identifier for the participant


Side
: Side of stimulation


Carrier_Frequency
: Carrier frequency of the stimulus


Amplitude
: Amplitude of the stimulus


epochs
: The epochs extracted from the recording


sweeps
: The extracted sweeps from the recording




Example


Put an example here


s = SSR(
filename
)
docs.title: Definition

docs.text:
Examples




Plot single and multi channel data


using EEG

s = read_SSR(
file.bdf
)
s = highpass_filter(s)
s = rereference(s, 
Cz
)
s = trim_channel(s, 8192*80, start = 8192*50)

plot_timeseries(s, channels=
P6
)
plot_timeseries(s)
docs.title: Examples

docs.text:
using EEG

s = read_SSR( file.bdf )
s = highpass_filter(s)
s = rereference(s,  Cz )
s = trim_channel(s, 8192*80, start = 8192*50)

plot_timeseries(s, channels= P6 )
plot_timeseries(s)
docs.title: Plot single and multi channel data

docs.text:
Functions


A number of functions are provided for the processing of SSR data.




Preprocessing




Filtering


#


EEG.highpass_filter
 
 
Method
.


highpass_filter(a::SSR; cutOff::Real=2, fs::Real=samplingrate(a), order::Int=3, tolerance::Real=0.01, kwargs...)




Applly a high pass filter.


A zero phase high pass filter is applied to the data using 
filtfilt
. A check is performed to ensure the filter does not affect the modulation rate. The filter coefficents are stored in the processing field.


Example


a = highpass_filter(a)
# or
a = highpass_filter(a, cutOff = 1)






Referencing


#


EEG.rereference
 
 
Method
.


rereference(a::SSR, refChan::Union{AbstractString, Array{AbstractString}}; kwargs...)




Reference data to specified channel(s).


Example


a = rereference(a, 
Cz
)
# or
a = rereference(a, [
P9
, 
P10
])
docs.title: Functions

A zero phase high pass filter is applied to the data using  filtfilt . A check is performed to ensure the filter does not affect the modulation rate. The filter coefficents are stored in the processing field.  Example  a = highpass_filter(a)
# or
a = highpass_filter(a, cutOff = 1)

a = rereference(a, [ P9 ,  P10 ])
